gt_description: Username parameter is concatenated directly into SQL, allowing an attacker to retrieve data via SQL injections
det_description: Raw SQL concatenation in getByUsername enables SQL injection vulnerability (Security: injection), allowing arbitrary database access and data exfiltration via malicious username parameters.

gt_description: Calling .get() on findByUsername() causes a NoSuchElementException (HTTP 500) on every login attempt with a non-existent username instead of returning the intended HTTP 401 Unauthorized
det_description: NullPointerException risk in checkLogin when userRepository.findByUsername returns empty Optional (Reliability: fault tolerance), causing application crash on non-existent username login attempts.

gt_description: Replacing .orElseThrow() with .get() in AddressServiceImpl.getById() causes an unhandled NoSuchElementException and returns HTTP 500 instead of the proper HTTP 404 whenever a client requests a non-existent address ID
det_description: NullPointerException in getById when addressRepository.findById returns empty Optional (Reliability: fault tolerance), crashing the application without proper error handling.

gt_description: someValue field in AddressRequest is ambiguous and does not clearly indicate its purpose. Frontend developers not know which data to provide
det_description: Mismatched validation field name 'someValue' instead of 'street' (Functional suitability: correctness), causing validation bypass and data integrity issues in address creation.

gt_description: PasswordEncoder created per request rather than as a singleton
det_description: Redundant BCryptPasswordEncoder instantiation in save (Performance: time behaviour), causing unnecessary CPU overhead and reduced throughput under load.

gt_description: PasswordEncoder created per request rather than as a singleton
det_description: Redundant BCryptPasswordEncoder instantiation in update (Performance: time behaviour), creating avoidable performance degradation in user update operations.

gt_description: Removing @PreAuthorize(admin) from the user deletion endpoint allows any authenticated user to permanently delete any account, including all administrators, leading to immediate and irreversible loss of system ownership
det_description: Missing @PreAuthorize on delete endpoint enables unauthorized user deletion (Security: access control), allowing any authenticated user to delete any account.

gt_description: Using @Autowired field injection instead of constructor injection reduces testability, hides dependencies, and makes the class harder to instantiate manually or refactor
det_description: Unnecessary @Autowired on field injection for UserRepository (Maintainability: modularity), promoting hidden dependencies and violating explicit constructor injection best practices.
